string.name: about_the_app_description
string.p: The Android Baseball League was specifically created by Michael Fazio for the Pragmatic Bookshelf book "Kotlin and Android Development featuring Jetpack". This includes all scores, stats, and teams in the ABL.

string.name: about_the_app_image_credits
string.p: Most images in the app were taken from FlatIcon.com or MaterialDesignIcons.com. For specific image rights, please use the button below. ↓

string.name: about_the_app_image_player_info
string.p: All references to real people in the league are likely on purpose unless, of course, they\'re not. Player names were randomly generated when the league was created, plus there were some real friends, family, and colleagues added.\nAlso, there are a few real players, like Jack Crooks, who somehow hit .213 in 1892 yet had a .400 OBP. Dude had 95 hits and 136 walks that season while slugging under .300. This may only be interesting to me and the Hidden Ball Trick guys (thanks Jeremy and Jim for the discovery!).

resources.string: Use Team Color for Nav Bar?
The Pewaukee Princesses are the brainchild of Hazel Fazio. She came up with the nickname, selected the logo, and chose to include her cousins on the team. Oh, and her \"Oddfather\" at catcher.
This is a notification from the ABLFirebaseMessaging Service focusing on %1$s.
Click this notification to go to Rolando\'s player page.
Click to go to the Princesses\' team page.
